definition[0]: the process of starting a new organization or group
example[0]: the formation of a new government
definition[1]: the process by which something develops into a particular thing or shape
example[1]: We now know a lot more about the early stages of planetary formation.
example[2]: the substances which lead to the formation of ozone
definition[2]: the way in which a group of things are arranged to form a pattern or shape
definition[3]: rock or cloud that is formed in a particular shape, or the shape in which it is formed
definition[4]: society, politics etc seen as a system of practices and beliefs
example[5]: Marx founded a new science: the science of the history of social formations.
definition[5]: the forming of a company, organization, or committee
example[6]: The government backs the formation of a single environment agency covering Scotland as well as England and Wales.
